intro: Thlaspi kurdicum, commonly known as Kurdish cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately divided, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in racemes. It produces slender, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. Thlaspi kurdicum is often found in regions of the Middle East and Central Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
